Mystics

Music and Performance
Mystics
7 — 8 pm
Wednesday, June 23, 2010
Remis Auditorium, MFA

In partnership with the Spanish Embassy and the Spanish Consulate of Boston, join us on June 23 at 7 pm for Mystics, a stirring musical and theatrical performance inspired by the Spanish mystics. Blending poetry from the 16th-century Spiritual Canticle written by St. John of the Cross during his imprisonment in Toledo, Spain, with music from a variety of such composers as medieval Magister Perotinus and Spanish Renaissance composer Cristóbal de Morales.
The works are musically juxtaposed with Arvo Pärt’s contemporary minimalism, whose purity of expression is also reminiscent of St. John’s language and works by Henryk Góreki. The drama plays out as actors portray St. John as prisoner, and his guard, who is transformed as he witnesses the poetry of his captive.

TICKET PRICES
MFA members, seniors, and students $20; general admission $25.
